2.0 - Standard Components

2.1 - Brand

The HBP brand should always be displayed with the Diamond and associated text. It is preferred to use real text for the title instead of an image regrouping the diamond and the text. This way, it can be selected and copy pasted as a real title in browser.

Default styling

Human Brain Project

The brand is an inline-block instead of a block

.hbp-brand-inline-block

Human Brain Project

Display the text below the diamond

.hbp-brand-vertical

Human Brain Project

The brand is vertically displayed as an inline-block

.hbp-brand-vertical.hbp-brand-inline-block

Human Brain Project

 
<h1 class="hbp-brand {$modifiers}"><span class="hbp-brand-logo"></span>Human Brain Project</h1>

2.2 - HBP Navbar /!\ Deprecated

This is a custom bootstrap navbar to use at the top of the site. It is made of three parts:

  1. The common site selector with class .hbp-site-selector
  2. The current site's menu with class .hbp-secondary-navbar
  3. The user widget with class .hbp-user-widget

The following example is missing Twitter bootstrap javascript lib or angular code to work properly.

Default styling
Styleguide
  • Websites
    • {{site.name}}
  • Actions
  • Browser
  • Tools
  • Jobs 0
  • User Name
    • Logout
 
<nav class="navbar navbar-fixed-top navbar-hbp" role="navigation">
       <div class="container-fluid">
           <div class="navbar-header">
               <button type="button" class="navbar-toggle">
                   <span class="sr-only">Toggle navigation</span>
                   <span class="icon-bar"></span>
                   <span class="icon-bar"></span>
                   <span class="icon-bar"></span>
               </button>
               <a class="navbar-brand hbp-site-current" href="#">
                 Styleguide
               </a>
           </div>
           <div class="collapse navbar-collapse" style="height: 0px;">
               <ul class="hbp-site-selector nav navbar-nav hidden-xs">
                   <li class="dropdown">
                       <a href class="dropdown-toggle">
                           <span class="visible-xs-inline">Websites</span>
                           <i class="glyphicon glyphicon-chevron-down"></i>
                       </a>
                       <ul class="dropdown-menu">
                           <li ng-repeat="site in sites" ng-class="{ active: isActiveSite(site) }"><a href="{{site.url}}">{{site.name}}</a></li>
                       </ul>
                   </li>
               </ul>
               <ul class="hbp-secondary-navbar nav navbar-nav">
                   <li><a href="#">Actions</a></li>
                   <li><a ui-sref="browse" ui-sref-active="active" href="#/projects">Browser</a></li>
                   <li><a href="#">Tools</a></li>
                   <li><a ui-sref="job-manager" ui-sref-active="active" href="#/job-manager">Jobs <bbp-job-badge><span class="badge badge-hbp badge-hbp-done">0</span></bbp-job-badge></a></li>
               </ul>
               <ul class="hbp-user-widget nav navbar-nav navbar-right">
                   <li>
                       <a href class="dropdown-toggle">
                           User Name <i class="glyphicon glyphicon-cog"></i>
                       </a>
                       <div class="dropdown-menu">
                           <ul>
                               <li><a href>Logout</a></li>
                           </ul>
                       </div>
                   </li>
               </ul>
           </div>
       </div>
   </nav>

2.3 - Toolbar

A toolbar can hold two kind of elements:

  1. at most one .hbp-toolbar-label that will typically contain some description of the content bellow the toolbar. If the content of the label is too long an ellipsis will be added.
  2. some .hbp-toolbar-action that will be clickable button. By default 5 buttons are allowed before the label and 5 after but this can be changed with the variables $hbp-toolbar-button-count. It can apply to a <a> or to any element with <a> as a child.

Usage Examples

Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.

Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.

Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.

Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.

Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.

Default styling
Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.

 
<div class="hbp-toolbar">
     <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-music"></i></div>
     <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-heart"></i></div>
     <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-envelope"></i></div>
     <div class="hbp-toolbar-label">Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.</div>
     <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-music"></i></div>
     <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-heart"></i></div>
     <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-envelope"></i></div>
     <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-glass"></i></div>
     <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-star"></i></div>
</div>
<br>

2.3.1 - Toolbar (expanded in bootstrap column)

If you load a toolbar inside a column, you might want to expand it over the column gutters. You can use .hbp-toolbar-expand class decorator.

Default styling
Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.

Some content

blah blah blah.

Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.

Some content

blah blah blah.

 
<div class="container-fluid">
  <div class="row">
    <div class="col-sm-6">
      <div class="hbp-toolbar hbp-toolbar-expand">
        <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-music"></i></div>
        <div class="hbp-toolbar-label">Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.</div>
        <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-heart"></i></div>
      </div>
      <h2>Some content</h2>
      <p>blah blah blah.</p>
    </div>
    <div class="col-sm-6">
      <div class="hbp-toolbar hbp-toolbar-expand">
        <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-music"></i></div>
        <div class="hbp-toolbar-label">Sed facilisis, arcu at tempus condimentum, dui mi dignissim velit, at aliquam enim velit in sapien. Nunc consequat placerat enim sit amet dignissim.</div>
        <div class="hbp-toolbar-action"><i class="glyphicon glyphicon-heart"></i></div>
      </div>
      <h2>Some content</h2>
      <p>blah blah blah.</p>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

2.4 - Lists

2.4.1 - Table View

2.4.1.1 - Simple Tableview

The lower limit of the table view is a fixed height constrained unstyled list.

Default styling
  • First Item
  • Second Item
  • Third Item
  • Fourth Item

Selectable Table View

.hbp-list-tableview-selectable
  • First Item
  • Second Item
  • Third Item
  • Fourth Item
 
<ul class="hbp-list-tableview {$modifiers}">
    <li class="hbp-list-tableview-entry">First Item</li>
    <li class="hbp-list-tableview-entry">Second Item</li>
    <li class="hbp-list-tableview-entry">Third Item</li>
    <li class="hbp-list-tableview-entry hbp-list-tableview-entry-selected">Fourth Item</li>
</ul>

2.4.1.2 - Tableview with heading

Default styling
  • Title
    First Item
    Second Item
  • Title
  • Third Item
  • Fourth Item

Selectable Table View

.hbp-list-tableview-selectable
  • Title
    First Item
    Second Item
  • Title
  • Third Item
  • Fourth Item
 
<ul class="hbp-list-tableview {$modifiers}">
    <li>
       <div class="hbp-list-tableview-heading">Title</div>
       <div class="hbp-list-tableview-entry">First Item</div>
       <div class="hbp-list-tableview-entry">Second Item</div>
    </li>
    <li class="hbp-list-tableview-heading">Title</li>
    <li class="hbp-list-tableview-entry">Third Item</li>
    <li class="hbp-list-tableview-entry hbp-list-tableview-entry-selected">Fourth Item</li>
</ul>

Render a table view with over and active state.

Default styling

Created At
Created By

Selectable Table View.

.hbp-list-tableview-selectable
Name
Created At
Created By

index.html

Orderable Table View

.hbp-list-tableview-orderable
Name
Created At
Created By
README.md
2012-08-23 10:32
John Doe
index.html
2012-08-22 9:43
John Doe
index.html
2012-08-22 9:43
John Doe
 
<div class="container-fluid hbp-list-tableview {$modifiers}">
  <div class="row hbp-list-tableview-header">
      <!-- Sorted Column -->
      <div class="col-xs-8 hbp-list-tableview-th">Name <span class="glyphicon glyphicon-sort-by-attributes"></span></div>
      <div class="col-xs-2 hbp-list-tableview-th">Created At</div>
      <div class="col-xs-2 hbp-list-tableview-th">Created By</div>
  </div>
  <div class="row hbp-list-tableview-body">
      <div class="hbp-list-tableview-entry">
          <div class="col-xs-8 hbp-list-tableview-td">README.md</div>
          <div class="col-xs-2 hbp-list-tableview-td">2012-08-23 10:32</div>
          <div class="col-xs-2 hbp-list-tableview-td">John Doe</div>
      </div>
      <!-- Selected Item -->
      <div class="hbp-list-tableview-entry hbp-list-tableview-entry-selected">
          <div class="col-xs-8 hbp-list-tableview-td">index.html</div>
          <div class="col-xs-2 hbp-list-tableview-td">2012-08-22 9:43</div>
          <div class="col-xs-2 hbp-list-tableview-td">John Doe</div>
      </div>
      <div class="hbp-list-tableview-entry">
          <div class="col-xs-8 hbp-list-tableview-td">index.html</div>
          <div class="col-xs-2 hbp-list-tableview-td">2012-08-22 9:43</div>
          <div class="col-xs-2 hbp-list-tableview-td">John Doe</div>
      </div>
  </div>
</div>

2.5 - Sidebar

A full height side bar with nested panels. The sidebar doesn't have a default width so you have to specify one, possibly with bootstrap grid system. Each panel's content will by default have a max.height of 215px.

Default styling
A title

Some content for the panel in a paragraph

Button group are allowed
but only xs

Or some content in a div

Another title
  • you
  • can have
  • list too
Another title
As are
desciption list
and table list
too

Full height with a y-scroller if necessary.

.hbp-sidebar-yscroll
A title

Some content for the panel in a paragraph

Button group are allowed
but only xs

Or some content in a div

Another title
  • you
  • can have
  • list too
Another title
As are
desciption list
and table list
too
 
<div class="example-box">
  <div class="hbp-sidebar {$modifiers}">
    <div class="hbp-sidebar-panel">
        <div class="hbp-sidebar-title">A title</div>
        <div class="hbp-sidebar-panel-content"><p>Some content for the panel in a paragraph</p></div>
    </div>
    <div class="hbp-sidebar-panel">
        <div class="hbp-sidebar-title">Button group are allowed
           <div class="btn-group"><div class="btn btn-default btn-xs">but only xs</div></div>
        </div>
        <div class="hbp-sidebar-panel-content"><p>Or some content in a div</p></div>
    </div>
    <div class="hbp-sidebar-panel">
        <div class="hbp-sidebar-title">Another title</div>
        <div class="hbp-sidebar-panel-content">
           <ul><li>you</li><li>can have</li><li>list too</li></ul>
        </div>
    </div>
    <div class="hbp-sidebar-panel">
        <div class="hbp-sidebar-title">Another title</div>
        <div class="hbp-sidebar-panel-content">
           <dl class="dl-horizontal"><dt>As are</dt><dd>desciption list</dd></dl>
           <dl class="dl-horizontal"><dt>and table list</dt><dd>too</dd></dl>
        </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
